intro: Microthelys minutiflora, commonly known as the minute flowered microthelys, is a small, delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically less than a centimeter in diameter. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes many other orchid species. Due to its small size and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
